<JD_START>
Job Title: Care Management Supervisor (Licensed) (37792)

Location: Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Job Details

Job Location

Erie Foster Avenue Health and Dental Center - 5215 N. Calif - Chicago, IL

Description

Join the Erie team! Motivated by the belief that healthcare is a human right, we provide high quality affordable care to support healthier people, families, and communities. Erie delivers holistic care to help every member of the family stay healthy and active from infancy through adulthood. Since 1957, we have provided high-quality care to diverse patients most in need, regardless of their insurance status, immigration status, or ability to pay.

Erie Family Health Centers, a top workplace in Chicago and suburbs, is looking for a valuable addition to our Care Management Team!The Licensed Care Management Supervisor leads a team of licensed care managers, including nurses and behavioral health professionals, that partners with medical providers, nurses, and patient programs staff to identify potential clients, assess their needs, and deliver comprehensive, high-quality patient care and supportive services.

At Erie, we are proud to provide competitive salaries, high-quality health care plans, generous time off benefits, retirement benefits, and more! Erie employees are eligible for Erie’s Full Benefits Package that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability Insurance and Flexible Spending (FSA) for Health Care or Childcare. Retirement Programs: 401(k) program with Erie matching $0.50 for every $1.00 up to the first 5% of the employee’s biweekly salary. Annual Paid Time Off: starting at 20 days of PTO, and 8 paid holidays. Competitive salary, annual merit increases, plus room for growth and career advancement. We are also offering a $3,000 sign-on bonus; $1,000 at 3, 6 and 9 months of employment. 

Main Duties & Responsibilities

Provides care management services and monthly follow-ups for a panel of 25 patients consistent with contractual and Erie requirements for quality and service excellence.Collaborates with patient programs, supervisor, providers, and care teams as well as uses Epic reports to identify appropriate patients for care management and identify internal support programs and services.Works with patient and patient’s care team to develop, document and monitor each patients’ individualized treatment care plan.Conducts chart reviews, utilizes electronic medical record, conducts brief and more comprehensive health risk assessments, motivational interviewing, and medication reconciliation to identify patients’ clinical concerns and acuity, risk factors, and barriers to achieving plan goals.Leverages clinical knowledge and expertise as well as Erie guidelines to support lifestyle and behavior change, offer education on clinical diagnoses and medical interventions, and provide resources to patients to support plan and address barriers.Provides care coordination to facilitate transition of care between hospital, consulting physicians, community resources, and Erie, including handling cases that require follow-up per external partner request.Document care team communication, resulting action steps, and activities in Epic for all participating patients, aligned with Erie and CARES Act standards (e.g., no medical jargon, etc.).

Qualifications

Education

 Bachelor’s degree required  Current Illinois licensure: RN or LPC/LSW or LCPC/LCSW required 

Experience

 3 or more years of direct nursing or behavioral health experience as a care manager or similar role required  2 years supervision experience required.  Experience working in community health or safety net settings preferred.  Medical or mental health case management experience preferred. 

Skills And Knowledge

 Bilingual fluency (English/Spanish) preferred. (May be required to assist or work with non-English/Spanish only speaking patients and/or guests.)  Strong computer skills: expert in Microsoft Office, Excel and ability to learn to expert level other electronic databases (Epic electronic medical record system, etc.).  Active CPR card required

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
